intro: Hieracium epipsilum, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are pale yellow to white, often with a dark central disk. Hieracium epipsilum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
